results.title: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Selznick International, David O. Selznick and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: This landmark film, based on Margaret Mitchell’s mammoth novel, won eight Academy Awards. The siege of Atlanta and the hardships of the South during the Civil War are masterfully unfolded in this terrific spectacle. Vivien Leigh’s performance as the headstrong Scarlett O’Hara is magical, and Clark Gable makes the ladies’ hearts flutter as Rhett Butler. Supported by Olivia de Havilland and Leslie Howard, the stars make this part spectacle, part history an epic entertainment.

results.title: Gone up north for a while
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Ronald Bowie and Paul Maunder
results.brief_description: A girl finds herself pregnant. She has no hope of marriage but knows that when her baby comes she will not give it up. She doesn’t know, but soon finds out, that society has no real place for her, and no understanding of the special needs of the unmarried mother and her child.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer, Mike Stenson and Dominic Sena
results.brief_description: In this remake of H. B. Halicki’s cult favourite, Nicholas Cage stars as Randall “Memphis” Raines, a master car thief whose desire to get out of the game is compromised when his brother becomes embroiled with a dangerous criminal. To save his brother Memphis must steal fifty cars in one evening, a task he undertakes with the aid of a motley crew. At the same time, another gang is undertaking the same challenge and the police are hot on the trail of both. Cast also includes Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Will Patton, Robert Duvall.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: H B Halicki Mercantile Co, Junk Yard and H.B. Halicki
results.brief_description: Sixty seconds is all it takes for professional car thief Maindrian Pace (H.B. Halicki, who also wrote, produced and directed) to steal a car, and he’s in the perfect position to fuel his habit - working for an insurance adjustment firm. With a script boasting real life stunt drivers who also happen to be associates of Halicki, this film features a 40 minute Mustang car chase sequence where it is reported that over 93 cars were destroyed. The film received mixed reviews, however it also received a cult following from those amongst the community who like mustangs, car chases, the seventies and a stunt co-ordinator let loose with a film camera.

results.title: Goliath II (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about an elephant only five inches tall, whose parents are ashamed of him until he rescues the stampeding herd from an attacking mouse. Narrated by Sterling Holloway.

results.title: Golfers in a Scottish Landscape
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Norman Prouting
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Scotland with information on Scotland’s golfing history and courses liberally interspersed between the normal tourist attractions.

results.title: Golf: history and tradition
results.brief_description: This dramatic video takes you on a pilgrimage to the heart and home of Scotland with a rare look inside the clubhouse at St. Andrews. Treasures of the past are revealed from feathery balls and longnose clubs, to the clubs in use today. See the development of golf course architecture by visiting the famous Link Courses.

results.title: Golf: a special kind of joy
results.creator_credit: National Golf Foundation and Tom Hilderbrand
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the Modern Golf Instruction series. Places importance on building a swing to suit each individual player. Looks at the role of each golf club in obtaining loft and length and demonstrates the use of each club group. The language of golf is discussed and the handicap system explained.

results.title: Golf: 50 steps to improve your game
results.brief_description: Hosted by professional golf teacher Richard Bradbeer and presented in 5 common sense sections - getting ready, getting started, getting round, getting out of trouble, and getting it in the hole, this tape provides 50 golfing tips for novices and experts alike. Addresses key golfing questions such as “How can I avoid the slice”? “What do I need?” “What’s the best way to tackle the ball?”. As well as many others.

results.title: Golf, the Australian way [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Golf is a sport in which many Australians excel. The film shows a variety of courses in Australia, explains the problems of course architecture and equipment manufacture, and also features scenes of the world’s top professionals during the 1972 Dunlop International and World Cup Tournaments in Melbourne. Photography by Dean Semler and Mick Bornemann. In Italian language - no English subtitles.
